author: danielniccoli
body:
On a german keybord, when pressing SHIFT-\` the @-character is inserted.
If you then press any other key, the \`-character is inserted.

So any combination with the accent key adds the @-character in front of the target character.

For example, this key combination

1. SHIFT-`
2. a
3. SHIFT-`
4. o
5. SHIFT-`
6. u
7. SHIFT-`
8. SPACE

results in 

``@à@ò@ù@` ``

instead of

``àòù` ``
